content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Great idea, it's also very suitable for Clash of Code!

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It is a pretty simple but also a little tricky of a question.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I've coded it in python in less than 5 min, 
it is a nice question, that is fun to solve.
Amazing idea, this looks good, I think you need to make it for reverse too, and like what 5DN1L said you need to change constraints and input and make it n small not N capital, and you are done!

Amazing. 
print(1+(int(input())-1)%9)
Would have never guessed that this is doing the trick (in Python). :-O

I find the hint formulated as a question a bit awkward.
I would suppose either to remove it or to replace it with "There is a trick to speed this up."
But even the hint would hardly help if you do not know this formula. Possibly hard to google...
In the Goal section you have named your variable n, but in the Input and Constraints sections you have named it N. Please make them consistent. Thanks.
